Frame.Nav: ROPS/FOPS certified four-post canopy provides operator protection against machine rollover and falling objects. For complete operator comfort, a cab configuration with high-visibility glass is available for CX compact excavators.

Hydraulically controlled backfill blade adds to machine stability and is available for light dozing work. CX compact excavators excel at digging a trench and laying pipe, then backfilling with the blade. The CX14 model has collapsible blade ends that allow the blade to retract for traveling through gates or narrow openings.
Durable rubber tracks are standard to prevent damage to asphalt, concrete or other surfaces. Short-pitch rubber used on the tracks results in minimal travel vibration and noise.

Undercarriage technology is comparable to that found on large excavators. Heavy-duty travel motors provide excellent ground drive traction, which is particularly beneficial when climbing slopes. Heavy plate guards prevent damage to the hydraulic motor piping.

The cover to the oil and gas tanks is made of an ultra-high molecular weight composite that is both durable and light weight. A breather on the oil tank prevents cavitation, rust and corrosion, and extends the life of hydraulic devices.
Fingertip control on the left joystick actuates both the swing and swing boom function. Moving the left control from side to side swings the upper frame of the excavator.
Two-speed travel button is located on right travel lever. High speed is available for traveling across straight, level terrain and low speed where greater traction is required.

Center-swing design allows the operator to dig directly alongside fixed objects. This parallel-digging feature makes these units ideal for working in tight spaces, whether a fenced-in backyard, or a cramped downtown construction site.

CX14 - 80 degrees left / 50 degrees right
CX25 - 58 degrees left / 65 degrees right
CX31 - 70 degrees left / 60 degrees right
CX36 - 70 degrees left / 60 degrees right
CX47 - 73 degrees left / 58 degrees right
Auxiliary hydraulics and plumbing offer bidirectional-hydraulic flow to the arms to provide power for a range of attachments.

Heavy plate guard protects hydraulic cylinder for backfill blade from blade overflow or damage from objects falling from the bucket. The hydraulic cylinder for the blade comes with joint-type piping for easy replacement.

A wide range of attachments such as hammers, augers and bucket thumbs give the operator more options and extend the machines’ capabilities.

CX14, 0.78 - 1.3 cubic ft / 0.022 - 0.036 cubic m
CX25, 1.4 - 3.0 cubic ft / 0.039 - 0.85 cubic m
CX31, 2.13 - 4.25 cubic ft / 0.060 - 0.12 cubic m
CX36, 2.13 - 6.6 cubic ft / 0.060 - 0.186 cubic m
CX47, 3.0 - 9.8 cubic ft / 0.085 - 0.277 cubic m

Swing-boom mechanism allows the front attachment to swing to the right and left by an amount that varies by model. The swing-boom bracket and turning mechanism is heavy-duty cast steel, specifically designed for durability and the intended use of auxiliary attachments.

Zero tail swing provides peace of mind when operating the machine in confined spaces where fences, buildings and other stationary objects otherwise would limit operation. With zero tail swing, counterweight does not extend beyond the tracks at any point in 360 degrees of rotation.

Parallel digging with center-swing boom allows the operator to dig alongside fixed objects, making it ideal for tight spaces such as cramped downtown construction sites and fenced-in suburban backyards.
Swing-out access panels give easy access to daily check points and service areas. The operator seat on the CX14 flips up to provide easy access to engine and components.
Engines in the CX series are quiet and reliable. Noise levels from 78 to 82 decibels allow these machines to work in urban and residential areas with little disruption.
Engine components are readily accessible via rear panel that swings outward. Ground-level access to all service points makes for easy daily service and improved uptime.
Heavy-duty travel motors provide excellent ground drive traction, which is necessary when climbing slopes.
One-touch engine deceleration allows the operator to lower engine RPMs to idle speeds minimizing fuel consumption and exhaust

Control-pattern selection feature allows the operator to choose the operating pattern of the joysticks: SAE or tractor loader/backhoe. When operating in SAE pattern, right joystick controls the boom up/down function while the left controls the arm in/out function. Functions are reversed in the tractor loader backhoe pattern.
The engines on the CX Compacts feature a “pusher” style fan that provides efficient cooling and simplifies maintenance by reducing accumulation of debris in heat exchanges.
A working light on the arm is standard.
An assortment of bucket widths are available. Maximum bucket capacity is 9.8 ft³ (0.277 m³). Maximum dig depth is 11 ft 11 in (3.63 m).
